meanings.definition: Wearing glasses with lenses that have two different focal lengths.
meanings.sent1: The bifocaled man could read small print and see far distances clearly.
meanings.sent2: She felt more comfortable with her new bifocaled glasses for reading and driving.
meanings.sent3: The bifocaled librarian never missed a detail, even in the tiniest font.
meanings.sent4: His bifocaled vision allowed him to see the world in a unique way, blending two perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The bifocaled lenses made everything crystal clear, like looking through a magnifying glass.

meanings.sent1: The bifocaled professor adjusted his glasses before starting the lecture.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's bifocaled spectacles helped her read her favorite books without strain.
meanings.sent3: The bifocaled detective solved the mystery by examining every clue with precision.
meanings.sent4: The bifocaled artist saw the world through a unique lens, capturing details others missed.
meanings.sent5: With his bifocaled glasses, he could switch focus effortlessly between near and far objects.

meanings.sent1: The bifocaled woman always carried a stylish case for her glasses.
meanings.sent2: The bifocaled grandfather enjoyed watching birds with his binoculars.
meanings.sent3: The bifocaled scientist made sure to clean his lenses daily for clear vision.
meanings.sent4: The bifocaled explorer navigated the jungle terrain with ease, thanks to his glasses.
meanings.sent5: Even in dim light, the bifocaled reader could easily switch between pages with ease.
